title: The luckiest generation: final salary schemes and the new state pension, who has it best in retirement?
text:
This is the third in a series in which Telegraph Money will answer the age-old question: which generation has had it easiest with money? We'll look at property, investment returns, savings rates and more.

Everyone imagines the dream retirement – perhaps reclining on a deckchair in an exotic locale or curled up with a book in the British countryside – but less enticing is planning how to fund it.

Pension saving has always been important but, as with all money matters, some generations have had it easier than others.

Today’s youngsters will look with envy upon the generous triple-locked state pension of their elders, but older women may well argue that today’s youngsters live in a more equal...
